intro: Miconia hispaniolica, commonly known as the Hispaniola miconia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and purple. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various insect and bird species. However, it is also considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
